page.title: 20THE TIBSHELF/HOLMEWOOD TRAIL
page.content: The Tibshelf to Holmewood Trail was opened in 1984. It is intended for walkers, cyclists and horse riders. For most of its length it follows the course of the disused railway, beginning at Tibshelf close to the site of the old station.The trail is a useful resource for environmental studies and will become increasingly important as it settles and develops. A group of children walked along the first mile of the trail from Tibshelf. They identified 14 species of bird, 9 kinds of tree and 7 kinds of flower. The large variety of weeds and grasses were harder to identify but these, together with the fungi, should provide fascinating areas of study. Insects and very small creatures (spiders, worms, slugs, snails, etc.) are plentiful but more difficult to observe.
